prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles, and the dimensions of the sides are equal. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin (0, 0, 0) with no rotation, represented by: coordinate\\_system: euler\\_angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] translation\\_vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] For the 2D sketch, draw a square on the X-Y plane. The square will be defined by the following loops and lines: sketch: face\\_1: loop\\_1: line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.7134, 0.0] line\\_2: Start Point [0.7134, 0.0], End Point [0.7134, 0.75] line\\_3: Start Point [0.7134, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Once the sketch is completed, scale it by a factor of 0.75: sketch\\_scale: 0.75 Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector: euler\\_angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] translation\\_vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis with a depth of 0.024 units in the positive normal direction. This will generate the 3D model: extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.024 extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 The resulting prism has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.024 The first part of the CAD model is now completed. Proceed with the next part using the information provided in the "parts" JSON object.</description>
